lst.name: sentence
lst.str: "Many companies, mainly export-oriented companies, were planning on selling their shares for a profit to reinvest in real businesses as the economy begins to pick up," said one analyst at a foreign brokerage.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The massive plunge in Tokyo stock prices on Tuesday could rob the Government of much-needed revenue to spur Japan's economy, and may hurt banks' ability to lend abroad, analysts polled by Reuters said.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: There is also concern that Japanese companies, which have invested heavily in Tokyo's stocks as their real business declined over the last two years, have sustained heavy losses.
